o Polyclagtin has been shown to be better than chromic for subcuticular perineal skin closure, but that is 
not usually available at most clinics 
o Place a vaginal tampon high in the vagina with an artery forceps attached 
o Make sure that the anal sphincter is not disrupted 
o Insert a suture close to the apex of the episiotomy in the vaginal epithelium 
o From the apex down, close the vaginal epithelium with a continuous suture
